催.definition: to urge; to press; to prompt; to rush sb; to hasten sth; to expedite

催乳.definition: to promote lactation; to stimulate lactation (e.g. with drug)

催命.definition: to press sb to death; fig. to pressurize sb continually

催奶.definition: to promote lactation; to stimulate lactation (e.g. with drug)

催婚.definition: to urge sb (typically, one's adult child or nephew etc) to get married

催情.definition: to promote estrus; to bring an animal to heat by artificial means

催收.definition: to urge sb to provide sth; (esp.) to press (for payment of a debt); debt collection

催更.definition: (slang) (of a follower) to urge (a blogger etc) to post some fresh content (abbr. for 催促更新[cui1 cu4 geng1 xin1])

催淚.definition: to move to tears (of a story); tear-provoking (gas); lacrimogen

催生.definition: to pressure a younger relative to hurry up and have a baby; (obstetrics) to induce labor; to expedite childbirth; (fig.) to be a driving force in bringing sth into existence

催產.definition: to induce labor; to expedite childbirth

催膘.definition: to feed livestock with highly nutritional food in order to fatten them up in a short time

催證.definition: to call for the issue of a letter of credit (international trade)

催賬.definition: to demand payment of money owed
